rigel.plugins.core.dockerfile.models module

name: str
classmethod validate_compiler(name: str) → str[source]

Ensure that the specified ROS package compiler used is supported by Rigel.

Parameters:

name (string) – ROS package compiler.

class rigel.plugins.core.dockerfile.models.PluginModel(*args: Any, compiler: Compiler, command: str = '', apt: List[str] = [], entrypoint: List[str] = [], env: List[Dict[str, Any]] = [], rosinstall: List[str] = [], ros_image: str, docker_run: List[str] = [], username: str = 'rigeluser')[source]

Bases: BaseModel

A plugin that creates a ready-to-use Dockerfile for an existing ROS package.

Variables:

  • command – The command to be executed once a container starts executing.

  • apt – The name of dependencies to be installed using APT.

  • compiler – The tool with which to compile the containerized ROS workspace. Default value is ‘catkin_make’.

  • entrypoint – A list of commands to be run while executing the entrypoint script.

  • env – A list of environment variables to be set inside the Docker image.

  • rosinstall – A list of all required .rosinstall files.

  • ros_image – The official ROS Docker image to use as a base for the new Docker image.

  • docker_run – A list of commands to be executed while building the Docker image.

  • username – The desired username. Defaults to ‘user’.

apt: List[str]
